pr_title: Issue 4791: Add a new controller API to fetch segments for a given epoch.

timeline.bodyText:
question: why do we need to get the segments for a txn again? when you create a txn, controller returns the txn segments, right?
so when is this getTxn api useful?
timeline.author: shiveshr

replies.bodyText:
TransactionalEventStreamWriter enables users to created transactions. The user can use

TransactionalEventStreamWriter#beginTxn() to create a new transaction
TransactionalEventStreamWriter#getTxn(UUID txnId) to fetch an already created transaction given its id. This is useful when the user knows a txnId and wants to perform operations on that transaction.

Both the above APIs return a io.pravega.client.stream.Transaction using which the user can
a. Write events to a transaction, Transaction#writeEvent
b. Commit a transaction, Transaction#commit() 
c. Abort a transaction, Transaction#abort()
d. Check the status of the transaction Transaction#checkStatus().
The new controller API ensures the correct segments are fetched when the user uses  [2.] getTxn(txnId) API.
replies.author: shrids
